main_definition: Before refers to a position in time or space that is earlier than the current point of reference, used as an adverb or preposition indicating prior occurrence.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In terms of time - Prior to a certain event or moment
meanings_and_examples.example: I arrived at the party before everyone else.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Prior to something in space, such as location
meanings_and_examples.example: The restaurant is located on the left side of the street, before you reach the park.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used with verbs to indicate an action was done prior or earlier than another
meanings_and_examples.example: She finished her homework before going out to play.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To introduce someone or something in the context of mentioning it first
meanings_and_examples.example: He introduced us to his friend, John, who is an engineer.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In legal terms, referring to a period before certain events occurred (e.g., statutes of limitations)
meanings_and_examples.example: The law states that any complaint must be filed within two years before the incident.
